intro: Onychium japonicum f. echizenense, commonly known as the Japanese onychium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, slender stems and clusters of small, pale green to white flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a slightly hairy texture. This variety is often found in shaded, moist environments, such as forest undergrowth, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
